title: How to Make Netherite Armor: Start-to-Finish Minecraft Tutorial

steps.title: Get a set of Diamond armor.
steps.content: Get a set of Diamond armor. You'll need a Diamond Helmet, Chestplate, Leggings, and Boots. If you don't already have a set of Diamond armor, you'll need 24 Diamonds to craft it. [1] X Research source You'll need 5 Diamonds for the helmet, 8 Diamonds for the chestplate, 7 Diamonds for the leggings, and 4 Diamonds for the boots. Diamond armor can be crafted in the 3x3 crafting grid. You don't have to do this step first, but you will need to get a full set of Diamond armor before you can make Netherite armor.

steps.title: Go to the Nether.
steps.content: Go to the Nether. You must get Netherite Scraps to create Netherite armor, which can only be found in the Nether. To access the Nether, you must go through a Nether Portal . You can build a Nether Portal with 14 Obsidian configured in a 4x5 rectangle (though you can leave out the corners and create a portal with just 10 Obsidian). Once the structure is built, light it on fire to activate the Nether Portal. [2] X Research source You can also access the Nether by fixing a Ruined Portal, if you've found one.

steps.title: Mine 16 Ancient Debris with a Diamond Pickaxe.
steps.content: Mine 16 Ancient Debris with a Diamond Pickaxe. Ancient Debris is an ore found in the Nether. It's a scatter ore, which means it is generated in dispersed clusters. [3] X Research source You can also use a Netherite Pickaxe to mine Ancient Debris, if you have one. If you use any other type of pickaxe, the mined Ancient Debris will drop nothing. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Smelt the Ancient Debris into Netherite Scraps.
steps.content: Smelt the Ancient Debris into Netherite Scraps. One Ancient Debris will be smelted into one Netherite Scrap when placed into a smelter with fuel. [5] X Research source You can smelt in a furnace, blast furnace , smoker, or campfire.

steps.title: Craft 4 Netherite Ingots.
steps.content: Craft 4 Netherite Ingots. Combine 4 Netherite Scraps and 4 Gold Ingots in the 3x3 crafting grid to make 1 Netherite Ingot. This recipe is shapeless, which means you don't need to put the materials in any particular configuration to craft the resulting item. 1 Gold Ingot can be crafted with 9 Gold Nuggets, or by smelting 1 Gold Ore, Nether Gold Ore, Deepslate Gold Ore, or Raw Gold. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Obtain a Netherite Upgrade Smithing Template.
steps.content: Obtain a Netherite Upgrade Smithing Template. Netherite Upgrade Smithing Templates can be found in Bastion Remnants. There is a 10% chance of finding one in a Hoglin stable chest, generic chest, and bridge chest, and a 100% chance of finding one in a treasure chest. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Duplicate your Smithing Template, or find more.
steps.content: Duplicate your Smithing Template, or find more. If you find one Netherite Upgrade Smithing Template, you can duplicate it with 7 Diamonds and 1 Netherrack. If you find 1 Smithing Template, you'll need 3 Netherrack and 21 Diamonds to duplicate it. You can, alternatively, keep searching for more Smithing Templates in Bastion Remnants.

steps.title: Craft a Smithing Table, if you don't already have one.
steps.content: Craft a Smithing Table, if you don't already have one. You'll need 2 Iron Ingots and any 4 Planks to craft a Smithing Table. Alternatively, you can use a Smithing Table that spawns in Toolsmith houses in Villages or in Trail Ruins. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Upgrade each piece of Diamond armor with a Netherite Ingot.
steps.content: Upgrade each piece of Diamond armor with a Netherite Ingot. Place a Netherite Ingot, a Netherite Upgrade Smithing Template, and a piece of Diamond armor in the Smithing Table to create a piece of Netherite armor. Repeat this step for the helmet, chestplate, leggings, and boots to create a full set of Netherite armor.
